alert.note: Alert for McDonald; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 6:49PM CDT until July 14 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Newton County in southwestern Missouri... McDonald County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 745 PM CDT. * At 649 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Purcell to Joplin to near Quapaw to near Welch, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Neosho, Big Sugar Creek State Park, Seneca, Granby, Anderson, Noel, Dodge, Goodman, South West City, Pineville, Loma Linda, Lanagan, Fairview, Newtonia, Stella, Stark City, Ritchey, Powell, Rocky Comfort and Racine. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 30. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
